intro: Tetramerium ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaf tetramerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. The fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
